Thanks, I now understand I did some mixed junit versions test.
So I want to=
 use JUnit4, but I am not succeding at that.
I have the code as you wrote, =
I am trying to do Run... to 
multiAttacherTest.
There I can choose JUnit an=
d under the test tab, there is Test class 
box, but in the search no class =
appears.
How do I run a test on multiAttacherTest with junit4?

Thank you,
=
Ofer.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...> 
w=
rote:
>
> Ofer,
> 
> On 7/17/07, oferstu <oferstu@...> wrote:
> >  import j=
unit.framework.TestCase;
> >  import junit.textui.TestRunner;
> >  import o=
rg.junit.Test;
> 
> You need to decide whether you're going to use JUnit 3.=
x or JUnit 
4.x
> API. If you're running on Java 5, I heartily recommend JU=
nit 4.
> Otherwise, your only option is JUnit 3.x.
> 
> 
> On 7/17/07, ofer=
stu <oferstu@...> wrote:
> >  public class MultiAttacherTest extends TestCa=
se {
> >
> >  	@Test public final void strongComponenetWalk() {
> >  		asse=
rtNull (null);
> >  	}
> >  	public static void main(String[] args) {
> >  =
		TestRunner.run (MultiAttacherTest.class);
> >  	}
> >  }
> >
> >  I get t=
his run time error:
> >  .F
> >  Time: 0
> >  There was 1 failure:
> >  1) =
warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)
> >  junit.framework.AssertionFailedEr=
ror: No tests found in
> >  graph.MultiAttacherTest
> >  	at graph.MultiAtt=
acherTest.main(MultiAttacherTest.java:51)
> >

> >  Tests r=
un: 1,  Failures: 1,  Errors: 0
> >
> >  If I add test in front of the meth=
od name, then it works. But 
this
> >  is the syntax of JUnit3, isnt it? It=
 should have worked with the
> >  code above?
> >  Also, if I have a method=
 with @Before annotation, then it won't 
run
> >  when I run the test.
> 
>=
 The behavior you're seeing is because you're running the test with 
a
> JU=
nit 3.8 test runner. Try converting your test to follow the 
JUnit 4
> API =
by getting rid of the "junit.framework" imports:
> 
> import static org.jun=
it.Assert.assertNull;
> import org.junit.Test;
> 
> public class MultiAttac=
herTest {
>     @Test
>     public final void strongComponentWalk() {
>    =
     assertNull(null);
>     }
> }
> 
> 
> Regards,
